intro: Grindelia oaxacana, commonly known as Oaxacan gumweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and disturbed areas. Grindelia oaxacana is known for its latex-like sap, which can be sticky and has been used traditionally by indigenous peoples.
